page.title: 17The Young and the Elderly
page.content: The people of Halstock are much less dependent than those of Pendomer on having cars for shopping and leisure activities. Older people who no longer drive can obtain nearly all their needs in the village shop or from travelling tradesmen and for "extras" there is the weekly bus to Yeovil. There is a good range of clubs and entertainment in the village, which has the advantage of being fairly compact. In all, it is a pleasant, friendly place for senior citizens - though medical care may pose more problems. For young people, the situation is more difficult. There is the youth club, but not much else, so they are dependent on parents and others to drive them around for many of their leisure activities - which can be frustrating and unsatisfactory for both sides!
